title: How to Spice Up Apple Cider

steps.headline: Mix the apple cider with the cranberry juice in the pot.
steps.description: Save the containers. The ratio of apple cider to cranberry juice is 3:1, so if you put in a jug of apple cider, you will need to put in a third of a jug of cranberry juice.

steps.headline: If you want extra cinnamon flavor, add a pinch of ground cinnamon to the cider.
steps.description: Although this step is optional, it creates a nice spicy balance to the flavor.

steps.headline: Simmer on low heat.
steps.description: Stir for a few minutes. Leave for about an hour, stirring occasionally then turn the burner off. Leave the pot on the stove overnight.

steps.headline: The next morning, pour the mixture into the empty containers.
Finished.
steps.description: To have a cup, pour the cider into a mug. Microwave it on high for one minute, plus or minus a few seconds. Drink with care as it will be very hot.

text: Mix the apple cider with the cranberry juice in the pot. Save the containers. The ratio of apple cider to cranberry juice is 3:1, so if you put in a jug of apple cider, you will need to put in a third of a jug of cranberry juice. Add the cinnamon sticks.  If you want extra cinnamon flavor, add a pinch of ground cinnamon to the cider. Although this step is optional, it creates a nice spicy balance to the flavor. Add the cloves.  Simmer on low heat. Stir for a few minutes. Leave for about an hour, stirring occasionally then turn the burner off. Leave the pot on the stove overnight. The next morning, pour the mixture into the empty containers. Enjoy! Finished. To have a cup, pour the cider into a mug. Microwave it on high for one minute, plus or minus a few seconds. Drink with care as it will be very hot.
